resources.string: A brew process emphasizing care, precision, and patience. Flavors brought out by this technique are distinctive - Usually described as fruity, bright, and clean.

Coffee, after it is roasted, contains carbon dioxide. By wetting the ground coffee before flooding it to brew, this gas is released. Fresh coffee is characterized by bubbling profusely when wet to bloom.
Coffee is best measured in grams. The recommended ratio to coffee to water is 19 grams to one cup.

Why does the time matter?: By maintaining a consistent and standard time, coffee brewed in a pour over is more likely to be balanced. It is recommended that a single cup takes three minutes, including the bloom time. If the brew process takes longer than it should, grind the coffee finer, and pour slower. If the brew process takes too long, grind coarser.

Coffee Grind: The grind of the coffee is very important. Too fine and coffee may taste bitter, while grind too coarse and it may taste sour and weak. Try to have a grind that brews a single cup in three minutes, including the bloom time.
